results.title: Eat, drink and be wary
results.brief_description: This film examines some of the problems associated with modern man’s increased reliance on manufactured and processed foods. Discusses the issues of additives, food processing, and the changes taking place in the American diet

results.title: Farm machinery safety
results.creator_credit: Reg Barrett, Allen Keen and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1970 film examines safety factors relating to farm machinery. The film outlines safety features of tractors, including overhead protective frames, guards, maintenance, braking, safety belts and hitching, as well as the importance of guards on a variety of large pieces of farm machinery. The footage includes tractors being used on the farm and examples of common accidents that can occur, inlcuding several scenes of tractors overturning in the field. Of particular interest are the examples of machinery used in the 1960s, including Ford and Massey-Ferguson tractors, the footage of testing on Rheem overhead protective frames and scenes of large dairy farms in New South Wales.

Produced by the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry and presented by the Rural Safety Advisory Service.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Trapper Murphy
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Describes the menace to sheep of dingoes and foxes in the Bogong High Plains in Victoria and shows something of the way in which they are being exterminated. Includes a shot of dingoes actually killing sheep at night.

Please be advised: this film includes scenes of animals being hunted and destroyed which may be distressing to viewers.

results.title: Water for life and living
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: The recreational facilities established by the Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works around its reservoirs through its beautification program provide ideal surroundings for picnickers and the film shows the attraction provided, as well as some stages of construction of the Cardinia Reservoir. Narrated by Geoff Raymond.

results.title: November = Novembre
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hundred and one lingering, luminous impressions of the month when the ripe fullness of the Canadian autumn wilts and the whole earth seems to settle into brooding calm. This is a cine-poem, reflecting the somber moods of November, the still, waiting separateness when the Canadian year dawdles, hangs back from the hour when the first snowfall will make all things even. But from the muted tones of the dying season emerges a new, stark beauty. Film without words. (Contains images of duck hunting and animial skinning that may offend some viewers.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Silent speech (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A study of non-verbal communication in young children featuring the work of biologist Prof. Hubert Montagner who has discovered a correlation between the behavior of children and the attitudes of the mother toward the child. He also suggests that physiological changes in the mother - specifically the level of various hormones - are mirrored in the child. Made by British Boradcasting Corporation.

results.title: Here They Know You
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
In country towns, opportunities for school leavers are limited. Diane and Peter have left school but don’t have jobs. They reflect on the relevance of school, the sense of community in a country town and the advantages of city and country life

results.title: Solar dawn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films
results.brief_description: Utilises many animation sequences to clearly show how basic solar collectors work. It shows how buildings can be heated and cooled by solar devices, and how city buildings and ordinary houses should be designed to take advantage of direct solar energy.
